main event: A bright white light was observed moving across the sky, from right to left, at an elevation of 30-40 degrees. The light appeared to grow brighter and then exploded, illuminating the sea for about 5-10 seconds.
interesting points: The light had a short trail of sparks or debris following it, which was brighter than the object itself.
Some witnesses described the explosion as having a shower of sparks like a sky rocket, while others said it was a brilliant flash without any sparks.
A merchant vessel in the area at the time gave its name as 'Dunkirk' by flashing its lights.
The object was plotted on a course of 096 degrees at a speed of 11.
The report indicates that the sighting was not identified.
sighted object: a bright white light with a trail of sparks or debris
